reviews.review_msg: He's an awesome lecturer, but the exams were BRUTAL. The final was multiple choice, and the questions were so confusing it was silly. Also, the guidelines for the paper weren't so clear and NO ONE got an 'A'. Actually, no one got an 'A' in the whole course. . . . He's good looking, but he's not so cute after the mid-term, let me tell you. . . .

Sean is a good prof. I'll stat with the negative. The only thing I can see being a problem is he sometimes seems disengaged with the content. I think he was forced into teaching this class which might have something to do with it. Either way I learned a lot from Sean. He really knows a lot about the material and is very approachable Take his class!

I took Geo 426 with Sean in spring 2016. Stemming from Sean's research on resource extraction practices of British Columbia, the course focused on both the history and present challenges of BC's forestry industry. Sean lectured the material in a clear and interesting manner, was extremely open to student ideas and was a fair marker. Would reccomend

This course on the Restructuring of BC's Forest Economy was one of the best I've taken in Geography. The class size was small allowing for good interaction and there's a cool field trip to the island. Roger teaches the course very well and is helpful.
